content.text: Vue Event Modifiers
Event modifiers in Vue modify how events trigger the running of methods and help us handle events in a more efficient and straightforward way.
content.html: Event modifiers in Vue modify how events trigger the running of methods and help us handle events in a more efficient and straightforward way.

content.text: Event modifiers are used together with the Vue v-on directive, to for example:
content.html: Event modifiers are used together with the Vue v-on directive, to for example:

content.text: How To Modify The v-on Directive
Event modifiers are used to define how to react on an event in more detail.
content.html: Event modifiers are used to define how to react on an event in more detail.

content.text: We use event modifiers by first connecting a tag to an event like we have seen before:
content.html: We use event modifiers by first connecting a tag to an event like we have seen before:

content.code_html: <button v-on:click="createAlert">Create alert</button>

content.text: Now, to define more specifically that the button click event should only fire one time after the page loads, we can add the .once modifier, like this:
content.html: Now, to define more specifically that the button click event should only fire one time after the page loads, we can add the .once modifier, like this:

content.code_html: <button v-on:click.once="createAlert">Create alert</button>

content.text: Here is an example with the .once modifier:
content.html: Here is an example with the .once modifier:

content.code: Click the button to create an alert:
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <p>Click the button to create an alert:</p>
  <button v-on:click.once="creteAlert">Create Alert</button>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    methods: {
      createAlert() {
        alert("Alert created from button click")
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Note: It is also possible to handle an event inside the method instead of using event modifiers, but event modifiers make it a lot easier.
content.html: Note: It is also possible to handle an event inside the method instead of using event modifiers, but event modifiers make it a lot easier.

content.text: Different v-on Modifiers
Event modifiers are used in different situations. We can use event modifiers when we listen to keyboard events, mouse click events, and we can even use event modifiers in combination with each other.
content.html: Event modifiers are used in different situations. We can use event modifiers when we listen to keyboard events, mouse click events, and we can even use event modifiers in combination with each other.

content.text: The event modifier .once can be used after both keyboard and mouse click events.
content.html: The event modifier .once can be used after both keyboard and mouse click events.

content.text: Keyboard Key Event Modifiers
We have three different keyboard event types keydown , keypress , and keyup .
content.html: We have three different keyboard event types keydown, keypress, and keyup.

content.text: With each key event type, we can specify exactly what key to listen to after a key event occurs. We have .space , .enter , .w and .up to name a few.
content.html: With each key event type, we can specify exactly what key to listen to after a key event occurs. We have .space, .enter, .w and .up to name a few.

content.text: You can write the key event to the web page, or to the console with console.log(event.key) , to find the value of a certain key yourself:
content.html: You can write the key event to the web page, or to the console with console.log(event.key), to find the value of a certain key yourself:

content.code_html:
<input v-on:keydown="getKey">
<p> {{ keyValue }} </p>

content.text: We can also choose to limit the event to happen only when a mouse click or a key press happens in combination with system modifier keys .alt , .ctrl , .shift or .meta . The system modifier key .meta represents the Windows key on Windows computers, or command key on Apple computers.
content.html: We can also choose to limit the event to happen only when a mouse click or a key press happens in combination with system modifier keys .alt, .ctrl, .shift or .meta. The system modifier key .meta represents the Windows key on Windows computers, or command key on Apple computers.

content.code: Try pressing the 's' key:
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <p>Try pressing the 's' key:</p>
  <textarea v-on:keyup.s="createAlert"></textarea>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    methods: {
      createAlert() {
        alert("You pressed the 'S' key!")
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Combine Keyboard Event Modifiers
Event modifiers can also be used in combination with each other so that more than one thing must happen simultaneous for the method to be called.
content.html: Event modifiers can also be used in combination with each other so that more than one thing must happen simultaneous for the method to be called.

syntaxHighlighting.text: "You pressed the 'S' and 'Ctrl' keys, in combination!"

content.code: Try pressing the 's' key:

syntax_highlighting.text: "You pressed the 'S' and 'Ctrl' keys, in combination!"

content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <p>Try pressing the 's' key:</p>
  <textarea v-on:keydown.ctrl.s="createAlert"></textarea>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    methods: {
      createAlert() {
        alert("You pressed the 'S' and 'Ctrl' keys, in combination!")
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: "You pressed the 'S' and 'Ctrl' keys, in combination!"

content.text: Mouse Button Modifiers
To react on a mouse click, we can write v-on:click , but to specify which mouse button that was clicked, we can use .left , .center or .right modifiers.
content.html: To react on a mouse click, we can write v-on:click, but to specify which mouse button that was clicked, we can use .left, .center or .right modifiers.

content.text: Trackpad users: You might need to click with two fingers, or in the lower right hand side of the trackpad on your computer to create a right click.
content.html: Trackpad users: You might need to click with two fingers, or in the lower right hand side of the trackpad on your computer to create a right click.

content.code: Press right mouse button here.
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <div v-on:click.right="changeColor"
       v-bind:style="{backgroundColor:'hsl('+bgColor+',80%,80%)'}">
    <p>Press right mouse button here.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        bgColor: 0
      }
    },
    methods: {
      changeColor() {
        this.bgColor+=50
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Mouse button events can also work in combination with a system modifier key.
content.html: Mouse button events can also work in combination with a system modifier key.

content.code: Press right mouse button here.
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <div v-on:click.right.ctrl="changeColor"
       v-bind:style="{backgroundColor:'hsl('+bgColor+',80%,80%)'}">
    <p>Press right mouse button here.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        bgColor: 0
      }
    },
    methods: {
      changeColor() {
        this.bgColor+=50
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: The event modifier .prevent can be used in addition to the .right modifier to prevent the default drop-down menu to appear when we right click.
content.html: The event modifier .prevent can be used in addition to the .right modifier to prevent the default drop-down menu to appear when we right click.

content.code: Press right mouse button here.
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <div v-on:click.right.prevent="changeColor"
       v-bind:style="{backgroundColor:'hsl('+bgColor+',80%,80%)'}">
    <p>Press right mouse button here.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        bgColor: 0
      }
    },
    methods: {
      changeColor() {
        this.bgColor+=50
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: It would be possible to prevent the drop-down menu from appearing after right click by using event.preventDefault() inside the method, but with the Vue .prevent modifier the code becomes more readable and easier to maintain.
content.html: It would be possible to prevent the drop-down menu from appearing after right click by using event.preventDefault() inside the method, but with the Vue .prevent modifier the code becomes more readable and easier to maintain.

content.text: You can also react on left button mouse clicks in combination with other modifiers, like click.left.shift :
content.html: You can also react on left button mouse clicks in combination with other modifiers, like click.left.shift:

content.code: Hold 'Shift' key and press left mouse button:
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <p>Hold 'Shift' key and press left mouse button:</p>
  <img v-on:click.left.shift="changeImg" v-bind:src="imgUrl">
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        imgUrlIndex: 0,
        imgUrl: 'img_tiger_square.jpeg',
        imgages: [
          'img_tiger_square.jpeg',
          'img_moose_square.jpeg',
          'img_kangaroo_square.jpeg'
        ]
      }
    },
    methods: {
      changeImg() {
        this.imgUrlIndex++
        if(this.imgUrlIndex>=3){
          this.imgUrlIndex=0
        }
        this.imgUrl = this.images[this.imgUrlIndex]
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Vue Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Provide the correct code so that the <div> element changes color when right clicked.
content.html: Provide the correct code so that the <div> element changes color when right clicked.

content.text: ALSO, add code so that the default drop down menu that appears when you right click a web page, is not shown.
content.html: ALSO, add code so that the default drop down menu that appears when you right click a web page, is not shown.

content.code: Press right mouse button here.
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <div v-on:click.="changeColor"
      v-bind:style="{backgroundColor:'hsl('+bgColor+',80%,80%)'}">
    <p>Press right mouse button here.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        bgColor: 0
      }
    },
    methods: {
      changeColor() {
        this.bgColor+=50
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Start the Exercise
content.html: Start the Exercise
